title: Bounds check removed from slice but not Vec

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
When optimizing rustc will sometimes fail to remove unnecessary bounds checks from accesses to a Vec, when it's capable of removing the bounds check if operating on an equivalent slice.

```rust
#[inline(never)]
fn print_elements(v: &Vec<u64>) {
    // Uncomment this to remove the bounds check.
    //let v = &v[..];
    let len = v.len();
    let mut i = 0;
    while len > i {
        println!("{}", v[i]);
        i += 1;
    }
}

fn main() {
    let v = vec![1,2,3,4];
    print_elements(&v);
}
```

This produces the following asm for the loop body (on Release Nightly on play.rust-lang.org)

```asm
playground::print_elements:
<snip prologue>
.LBB1_2:
        cmpq	%rbx, %r14
	jbe	.LBB1_5
	movq	%r12, 8(%rsp)
	movq	core::fmt::num::<impl core::fmt::Display for u64>::fmt@GOTPCREL(%rip), %rax
	movq	%rax, 16(%rsp)
	leaq	ref.4(%rip), %rax
	movq	%rax, 24(%rsp)
	movq	$2, 32(%rsp)
	movq	%r13, 40(%rsp)
	movq	$1, 48(%rsp)
	movq	%rbp, 56(%rsp)
	movq	$1, 64(%rsp)
	movq	%r15, %rdi
	callq	std::io::stdio::_print@PLT
	incq	%rbx
	addq	$8, %r12
	cmpq	%rbx, %r14
	ja	.LBB1_2
<snip epilogue>
	retq
.LBB1_5:
	leaq	panic_bounds_check_loc.1(%rip), %rdi
	movq	%rbx, %rsi
	movq	%r14, %rdx
	callq	core::panicking::panic_bounds_check@PLT
	ud2
```

I'm not very familiar with the compiler internals, but this seems like an LLVM deficiency.  A reasonably sophisticated jump threading pass ought to catch this.
